subject: linear_algebra
title: Matrix Representation of Linear Transformations
contentHtml: A linear transformation between vector spaces can be represented by a matrix.

theorem.statement: \[ \text{If } T: V \to W \text{ is a linear transformation, then there exists a matrix } A \in \mathbb{R}^{m \times n} \text{ such that } Av = T(v) \]
theorem.proofSketch: The proof involves showing that the matrix representation satisfies the properties of linearity and scalar multiplication.

intuition: This theorem provides a way to represent complex transformations between vector spaces using matrices, which can be easily manipulated and composed.
realWorldApplications: In machine learning, this theorem is used in neural networks to represent complex transformations between layers.
